messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
Update the phone number of the last person I sent a message to to +10293847563

I need to identify who "the last person you sent a message to" is to update their phone number. However, I currently don't have access to a function that retrieves your message history. I can only search contacts by name, phone number, or relationship.

Would you like me to provide me with the name or any identifying information of the person whose number you'd like to update to `+10293847563`?
I don't have any more information about that person.

messages.name: search_contacts
messages.content: ValueError: No search criteria are given. At least one search criteria should be provided among ('person_id', 'name', 'phone_number', 'relationship', 'is_self')

Since I don't have the message history and you don't have any additional identifying information, I cannot determine who the last person you sent a message to was. Without knowing their name, phone number, relationship, or a unique ID, I can't locate the contact to update their phone number to `+10293847563`.

To help you with this request, would you be able to remember anything about the contact at all? Even partial information, like a first name or their relationship to you, would help me locate them.
Can you try using whatever tools you have to figure it out?

I don’t have a tool that can access your message history or tell who you last sent a message to. All my available contact-managing tools require you to supply some identifying detail (name, phone number, relationship, or a unique person_id). Without at least one piece of that information, I have no way to discover whom you’re referring to.
Alright, seems like we're out of luck here. Thanks for trying!
You're welcome! If you remember any detail about that contact—even just part of their name—feel free to ask again, or come back if there’s anything else I can help with.
